results.title: Forrest Gump [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Zemeckis, Steve Starkey, Steve Tisch, Wendy Finerman, Steven Tisch and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Forrest Gump touched the hearts and minds of filmgoers and scooped the 1994 Academy Awards. Forrest Gump, sensitively portrayed by Tom Hanks, has a low IQ but through the fierce determination of his mother (Sally Field), takes his place upon the stage of history as the events of three decades unfold around him. Forrest’s naive perception of the world contradicts the harsh realities of the Vietnam War and the disillusionment of the “flower power” generation, while his “rags to riches” story is pure fairytale. Nevertheless, Forrest’s courage, his strong sense of values and his simple innocence allow him to weather adversity. The special effects editing which allows Forrest to make his mark on history is noteworthy together with strong cast performances. Cast also includes Gary Sinise and Robin Wright.

results.title: Forrest Gump
results.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as one of the most memorable characters in cinematic history, Forrest Gump, the big-hearted man who was there in the biggest moments in American history. Directed by Robert Zemeckis and written by Eric Roth won six Academy Awards.

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

constellations_other.name: Nadia Tass
constellations_other.description: Comedic and cult classics take centre stage in Nadia Tass' career.

results.description: By 1994, when Forrest Gump was released in the States, computer-generated imagery (CGI) had developed to a point where it facilitated almost seamless visual effects. CGI and greenscreen technology allowed Forrest Gump (Tom Hanks) not only to interact on-screen with historical figures including John F. Kennedy, John Lennon and Lyndon B. Johnson but also to memorably compete in a table tennis tournament in which the ping pong ball was digitally grafted onto the action. The uplift and homespun bonhomie of Gump’s character offered American audiences a story of an American war veteran they could champion and take to their hearts. The film was a box office hit and won six Academy Awards including Best Picture, Best Director, Best Film Editing and Best Effects, Visual Effects.

results.title: Formulas and equations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Introducing Chemistry”.
This is the first of three films for a beginning unit in chemistry. It explains and demonstrates the basic language of chemistry, the symbols used in formulas and equations. Acids, bases and salts are defined in terms of their formulas. Basic terms encountered include compound, gas, precipitate and radical as well as the concepts of structural formulas and “balanced” equations.

results.title: Formula 1: Drive to Survive
results.brief_description: Drivers, managers and team owners live life in the fast lane — both on and off the track — during one cutthroat season of Formula 1 racing.

results.title: Forms of music: instrumental
results.brief_description: Most of the major forms of instrumental music are presented, using animation. Music of Bach, haydn, Mozart and Beethoven illustrate the historical development of the sonata form, the clasical sonata, the concerto, the symphony, and the tone poem, as well as earlier forms of music.

results.title: Formosa today
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bradley, Associated Television and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Progress in Formosa (Taiwan) since the arrival of Chiang Kai-Shek, and American post war aid. Rapid development in industry and agriculture, roads and railways, education. With greater prosperity, America’s aid is decreasing, and foreign investment increasing. Poses the questions, whether Chiang Kai-Shek has been successful in presenting Formosa as an alternative to Communism.

results.title: Forming, feeding and assembly
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding, Humphrey Barron and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Approaching Automation”.
Discusses various means of adapting existing equipment, by adding to it or redesigning it. Much manual work can be cut down by installing timing devices and automatic controls, improving feeding methods and reassessing assembly procedures. Shows new methods of mechanical fastening, including the new adhesives. Stresses need to adhere to International and British Standards.

results.title: Forming of metals
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, Raymond Spottiswoode and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Methods of forming metals and the qualities they impart to the finished articles. Pressing, hot and cold rolling, forging, drop forging, forging wagon wheels and seamless tubes, drawing and extrusion. Models and micro graphs show the changes in internal structure brought about by forming and annealing. Photographed by Sidney Beadle, Eric Chamberlain. (Award: Documentary Grand Prix, Brussels, 1958).

results.title: Formats
results.brief_description: The Blackmagic Design Media Preservation Lab handles a wide range of media formats. Much of our collection is contained on 16mm film and domestic videotape formats but we also handle 35mm, 9.5mm and 8mm film, early commercial video formats such as 2” and 1” tape, various other commercial and semi-professional videotapes, born digital works on hard drives, games cartridges, thumb drives and audio formats. Preserving such a wide variety means we must also maintain the legacy equipment associated with each format.
